text: Hi guys! I'm new here, just wanted to ask if anyone was able to use HubSpot api through javascript without having a cross domain issue?
yes, but you have to mirror the api with your own server
i ran into this issue and wrote a blog post on how i worked around it here: <https://www.kelp.agency/blog/how-to-enable-cors-ajax-requests-for-any-HubSpot-api>

Thank you <@U7V9DQ31P>! seems that there's no other way than mirroring it in your own server. would be good if HubSpot itself allow us to directly load it though ajax. Thank you again :slightly_smiling_face:

^ If it's a simple use-case, I have leveraged Zapier webhooks for this. Make request to Zapier, Zapier calls to HS, then gives response back to client. it's not ideal, but if you're just doing something simple and fast it can be more efficient than configuring authentication yourself
<@U26BLKGE4> haven't tried Zapier yet, I guess I might try it sometime :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks mate!
